item.description:
Hello All,

I am happy to announce that the Brazilian Immigrant Center will start a Level 2 Portuguese May 5th at 7:00pm.

Instructor:  Carmem Denadai Nicoli.  Ms. Nicoli is Brazilian. She is from Minas Gerais. She has a degree in Portuguese from two universities in Brazil. She also has a degree in Brazilian literature. Before coming to the United States, she taught Portuguese  in high schools for 10 years.  She is extremely excited about this course. 

Goals:  This course is for people interested in learning to speak, read, and write Brazilian Portuguese.

First Class: If would be best if everyone came to the first course.
There Carmen would like to talk with you and or hear your Portuguese. She will also pass out three levels of texts (easy, medium, and hard)  You will be asked to read them out loud and then write something about the text. RELAX!!!!
These exercises are intended to assess your reading, writing and speaking capabilities.  At this point, based on your self assessments we are looking at a level 2 course. However, even in a level 2 course there will be people who are advanced at some things and a beginner at others.
So, we (Professor Nicoli and I) encourage everyone to come to the first class. 

Classes:  All classes will include a speaking, writing and reading component.  They will last for one and half hour maximum.  All classes will be taught in Portuguese.   We hope to have Brazilian volunteers coming to the classes to assist in small group discussions.

Refund Policy:  Please note if you are not satisfied after the first class you are entitled to a full refund. You will not receive a refund if you attend more than two classes.

Materials: Prof Nicoli has several books and resources that she will collect and copy and have handed out classes.  Please be prepared with a binder or folder to collect the handouts, homework assignments, and texts.

Assessment and additional classes:  Prof Nicoli will adjust the classes based on the needs of the majority of the students.  However, if its clear that another level of Portuguese classes needs to start,  the Brazilian Immigrant Center and Prof Nicoli will assess costs, interest and sustainability at the Center.

Again, I encourage all to come to the first lesson if you are interested. In some cases, you may be higher or lower than you think.


Please  pay in advance before the course.  The amount is $120.00.  Please let others know about the course as well. I will send out additional emails. You can mail your checks to The Brazilian Immigrant Center, 14 Havard Ave, 2nd Floor Allston MA. You can also drop off payment.  You will not be permitted to attend the first class unless you have made payment. Again, if you do not like the course you will be entitled to a full refund after you're first lesson.

Excited!
